definition: to miss an appointment
bright/clear/crisp/open/frank/straightforward/to feel well/fine/pleasurable/invigorating/to deviate
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: He is punctual. He never breaks his words.
Nothing is more irritating than being stood up.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一件事比苦等爽約的人更令人氣惱的了。

sentences.english: No, I won't break the appointment.
Last year his moment of glory came when John McCain cancelled on him.
sentences.chinese: 去年當麥凱恩爽約，他的光輝時刻便來臨了。

sentences.english: Remind your partner that it’s better to decline a task than to break a promise.
sentences.chinese: 提醒你的伴兒，有時候推掉一件事比爽約要好。

sentences.english: Not many believers left after the 2009 verdict.
sentences.chinese: 自2009年他們爽約之後相信他們的人就不多了。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
switchboard operator
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
